intro: Nycteranthus leptopetalus, commonly known as the moonflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its stems are woody and branching. Nycteranthus leptopetalus thrives in humid, tropical environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
